author: mafon2
title: A case of yellow suitcase and some bricks
review:
Ok, it's cool seeing "4-99" age gap on Classic sets, but in most cases it's a mislead. I doubt that anyone above age of 6 will find anything engaging about this set, except for two transparent domes. Pieces included are pretty basic and come in vast variety of colors, which I'm not a big fan of, 'cause it's hard to build something monochrome. For example, there are only 10 green pieces.

The suitcase is made of, at least, two types of plastic (it's two halves are of different shade of yellow), barrier plates fit with difficulty and tend to get bendy. You can place them in two ways, making 4 identical sections. There's also two kinda-sections, which are connected with the handle and hence having lower brim and possibility to mix up. The lid doesn't shut tight and leaves gaps on both sides.

If you dump all bricks in it, there'll be some room left for the future pieces. And that's what this set is about, I guess, – "My 1st Lego container I'll fill to the brim". Or possibly it can be used as a go-out set, in which kids can place their favorite stuff. In other words: "it's all about suitcase".
